Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Stylee pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of lotus flower in added white outline and added red; traces of white band below; exterior: curled swastika as filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd with others in the Wild Goat Style, but the interior decoration suggests it is slightly later, possibly belonging to the Mature Animal Style group. The number 58 is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 240, no. 204)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0451) (phase 2)
